alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 2:03AM PST until January 08 at 9:39AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Rain yesterday pushed the Skokomish River in Mason County just above flood stage last evening. Additional rainfall today will likely keep the river above minor flood stage today.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. WAC045-081745- /O.CON.KSEW.FL.W.0001.000000T0000Z-230108T1739Z/ /SRPW1.1.ER.230108T0534Z.230108T0600Z.230108T0838Z.NO/ 203 AM PST Sun Jan 8 2023 ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Skokomish River At Potlatch. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM PST Saturday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday, January 07 to a crest of 16.5 feet Saturday, January 07. It will then fall below flood stage early this morning. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 12/14/1995. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
